a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Relative poverty: Share of population below 40% of the median
Relative poverty is measured in terms of a poverty line that rises and falls over time with average incomes – in this case
set at 40% of the median income or consumption.
Data source: World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2024)

Note: Depending on the country and year, the data relates to income measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption,
per capita
.
